snippet: The contenders in the best-actor Oscar race aren't campaigning, unless you count all those television and press appearances this week.
abstract: The contenders in the best-actor Oscar race aren't campaigning, unless you count all those television and press appearances this week.
lead_paragraph: There is good news for fans of Gary Oldman, who somehow span the generations from "Sid & Nancy" to "Harry Potter." Mr. Oldman, even more amazingly a first-time Oscar nominee only this year, for his performance in "Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy," is the subject of a film retrospective in New York this week, organized by WNYC and Focus Features. (Get tickets to one of the free screenings of "Sid & Nancy," "JFK" or "Bram Stoker's Dracula" here.) Mr. Oldman himself will do a Q. and A. following a screening of "Tinker" on Wednesday.

headline.main: May the Best Actor Get the Most Attention
